p: Both oregano and thyme belong to the same family ( Lamiaceae), producing aromatics as major essential oil constituents. Our GC-MS analysis of oregano and thyme EO volatile constitutes showed that the major volatile compound was thymol ( Table 4 and Figure S1). Thymol represented 99.44% of oregano EO and 72% of thyme volatile compounds. Other volatiles identified were at much-lower levels in both oils and include p-cymene, cineole and Î³-terpinene ( Table 4).
